children.subject: Highly recommend this decal! It does an amazing job of bridging the gap between Berkeley classes and the tools used in industry.
COMPSCI 198 073
Is the course number for this decal available yet?

If you are already taking upper div CS classes, I would assume you should be relatively comfortable working on projects. The workload for the class for a typical week would encompass the two lectures, (an hour and a half each) and any homework/project component that is assigned. The homeworks will obviously be shorter than the projects, and should realistically take at most 2 hours to finish. When the project is assigned, that is when the majority of the workload happens. The project will take an estimate of 2-9 hours of work each week depending on how comfortable you are with programming and working on projects. If you are very comfortable and experienced, you can even potentially finish the week's portion of the project within 2 hours.

I would love to take this class (especially Cyrus is teaching it too!). I'm in CS W186 and seeing the workload of that class, I was thinking of doing something else (I'm in two other techs already and another 4 unit). Aryan pointed out this decal does an amazing job of bridging the gap between Berkeley classes and the tools used in industry. So more interested in signing up. Also golang is taught. Can someone from the staff or another person who has taken it explain if this would be a good move? 

Thank you so much! :)

It depends on how comfortable you are with programming. Once the project is assigned, you can expect anywhere from 2 hours to maybe 9 hours of work per week (conservative estimate). As for the time range, that is where the experience part comes in. If you have prior experience working on projects, say have completed 61b, then you will probably be looking at a time closer to the 2 hour side than the 9 hours. The course will also have office hours in which you can attend if you have any questions regarding content or project. When I was a student for the course, I was also doing a similar schedule as you and was able to handle it just fine having finished 61b.
What if we're taking 61b at the moment?

How much time should this class take per week? I am already taking 2 tech classes + 1 math class, and I don't want to bite off more than I can chew.

Thanks in advance!
As long as it is a valid reason, we'll accommodate for that.
I noticed attendance is part of the grade. Would there be accommodations for time conflicts?

As of now, I really cannot give you a concrete answer. The original plan for this course was to be accept everyone who applied since we have most of the infrastructure set up to support it (Autograder for the project on Gradescope). However, we realized that there are still elements that required our actual staff to be involved, such as office hours, that would impose a limit on the number of students that we can ultimately end up supporting. We'll try and accept as many students as we can and I can promise you that the number of students we'll be accepting will be a large amount of the students who applied.

[Update: We might not be able to accept as many students as we would originally like due to further staff/resource constraints.]
So if I applied 2 days ago I should get in right? What would cause someone to be rejected?

When will decisions be made?  Will they be on the fly as applications are turned in, or after 9/11?  I need 3, maybe 4 more units in order to qualify for full time and I’d rather not wait for something which might not happen.
It is required, but we'll have an accommodation form for students to fill out in regards to any conflicts such as time zone conflicts or conflicts with other lectures.
Is live lecture attendance required for this course? I may have a time conflict with the lecture time so I'm wondering if there will be any recordings available.
Yes. We'll hopefully offer it every semester from now on if circumstances permits us to do so.
Highly interested in this course but not sure if I can take it this semester. Are there plans to offer this course in future semesters?
We won't have decisions out until the 8th.

Can we know the decision before the early drop deadline Sep 3? I really need the units to fullfill the full-time requirement and have really high interests in this decal class. I'm a little bit worried since the website is still not updated for this semester until tonight :(
What is the criteria used to rank applications? Is it first come first served, experience or something else?
^ would appreciate some transparency on the application process

UPDATE: Due to unprecedented demand, we will be unable to hold infosessions. We are also moving our application deadline up, and anticipate having decisions / enrollment codes out by September 8th. We appreciate your understanding.
Any updates on decisions?
Any updates on decisions?
Tonight or tomorrow morning latest.
Any updates on this?
Codes have been sent out!
if we didn't get an email does that mean we got rejected?
Unfortunately, yes :(
oof could we get any insight to why an app would be rejected :(
When can we expect decisions today?
OMG this admission to decal is ridiculious. Give anyone explain what is admission based on?
Last semester’s recordings and slides are still up if you’re interested
Is it possible to share the recording with those who did not get in? I really want to take the class
Ouch I would have signed up for other decals if I knew this would happen. Guess it means I have an easier semester.
If we want to audit the course, can we follow along with this semester's lectures? Seems like the website is still Fall 2020.
Same here, would it be possible to let us know how many people applied and how many got admitted?

How many people got admitted? I'm upset with the outcome since I have applied for this course very early and TA promised that everyone will be accepted but now I need to look for 3 units somewhere else.
Next time don't tell us everyone will probably get in if that's not even close to the case :||
Bruh did I not get in because I did not get an email ??? What's the criteria ??

history.content:
Hi everyone,

The Cloud Computing DeCal (website out of date) is now accepting applications for Fall 2021! Apps will be due at 11:59 PM on September 11th September 6th. We will try to take as many students as we can, though we are constrained on resources. The syllabus can be found here.

Additionally, we will be holding infosessions (most likely virtually) on September 7th (Tuesday) and 10th (Friday), 6pm-7pm both days. We will update this post closer to the dates with the Zoom links and additional information, so stay tuned!

UPDATE: Due to unprecedented demand, we will be unable to hold infosessions. We are also moving our application deadline up, and anticipate having decisions / enrollment codes out by September 8th 9th. We appreciate your understanding.

UPDATE 2: enrollment codes have been sent out!
